intro: Werneria heteroloba var. obtusiloba, commonly known as the broad-leaved Werneria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical regions of Africa, this plant thrives in humid, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and vibrant floral display. The plant is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
